Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 06:30PM kpopperwell wrote: Hi Krissy, I finished 31 rounds on July 23 and seem to be more tired everyday.  Can't seem to get enough sleep or maybe I am not getting a restful sleep.  I still am healing from the burns and can't always find a comfortable position to sleep. Karin in CA
Posts.Title: Endless FATIGUE......Anyone?? Krissy37 Krissy37

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2008 09:33PM kpopperwell wrote: Hi Sandy,  I had my cat scan on a Tues and they did all kinds of markings with a red felt pen and even did the boost markings.  Told me to be careful not to wash off all those markings before the simulation.  Had the simulation on Fri so it was a fun three days of showering very carefully.  On simulation day I got my tats and could finally take my last few "soaks" in the shower before the rads started on June 10.  Just the souund of having these tests can be intimidating but they are easy. Have a good day Karin in CA
Posts.Title: CAT Scan before treatmetns begin? easyquilts bcs75

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2008 11:23AM kpopperwell wrote: Hi Sandy, From day 1 the techs said to put on the aloe vera on the area being radiated.  I think everyone is so different in their reaction to the rads as to when the se's start.  I turned pink at the end of the first week and it just progressed from there.  I had no idea I would end up with the burns I have.  The one thing that feels good now is the Biafine.  I also use calendula cream mixed with lidocaine (prescription) it numbs the area so that it is more comfortable.  I also have pure emu oil.  I researched this and the results are amazing as to how it heals the burns.  I only have two areas - under the arm and under the breast.  Since it is my right side and I am right handed it seems to irritate it more.  At home now I am wearing DH old white t-shirts that I have cut the neck and sleeves out.  No seams = no irritation. I only have 3 boosts left and then I will have 4 straight days off from work.  I will help but it will not be enough but we are short handed at work.  I have also used DH soft cotton handkerchiefs to put under the breast to absorb moisture and to pad the underarm when I wear tank tops to keep the arm from contact with area. I hope that you do not get too many of the se's. Take care, Karin in CA
Posts.Title: How Early can SE's begin? easyquilts AccidentalTourist

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2009 01:48AM kpopperwell wrote: Another site with a wide variety of medical bracelets is laurenshope.com I think that I could make them myself now that I have seen how they are made. Good luck. Karin in CA
Posts.Title: Wear to buy cool LE Bracelet? Estepp lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: kpopperwell wrote: Hi all, Has anyone tried emu oil on the rad burns?  I have tried everything else but cannot get the burns that are peeling to stay soft enough to be comfortable.  I use aloe and calendula just before going to bed but by 5 a.m. it is burning so much that it wakes me up.  On the weekend that is a bummer.  I get up and put either the aloe or calendula on, it burns more for a minute, then goes back to being tolerable.  The rad nurse said not to put the Biafine on the open areas where the skin is peeling the the skin underneath is really tender.  I had another suggestion from someone who is on his second rad bout and he said to use Vit E oil. What do you think?  Thanks Karin in CA . p.s. I will be done on July 23, yay!!!!  Onco Dx 8, No Chemo, Arimidex for 5 years Dx 2/16/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Emu oil for burns kpopperwell kpopperwell

Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 11:02AM kpopperwell wrote: Hello everyone, I am newly diagnosed, have had a lumpectomy and 6 nodes removed March 7.  Went back to work 12 days later.  Saw my Medical Oncologist for the first time today.  She would like me to join a clinical trial that would determine randomly if I would have chemo and the AI drugs or no chemo and just the AI.  I had to authorize the Oncotype DX Assay to be done and now have to wait two weeks for the results.  During this time I have to decide if I will be part of the clinical trial or not.  Either way the score from the DX assay will be the most important  thing.  I did not think that I was going to even have to make a decision re chemo and right now I am feeling like brain overload.  I want to do what is best for me but have mixed feelings about clinical trials.  I am fortunate that I have an HMO that has a small co pay.  I will try to check in often to see how everyone is doing and by reading your posts will give me peace of mind that this too shall pass. I look forward to meeting all of you.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 12:23PM kpopperwell wrote: Thank you, otter.  I will face my decision on May 15 when I see the Dr again.  I will continue to come and read posts as I find it comforting to be with people who are in the same boat.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 11:07AM kpopperwell wrote: Hi Diana Are your last nine boosts?  If not, maybe they could do the boosts then go back and finish the regular tx's.  I found that the boosts were easier.  I my first boost on a Thurs, next on  Fri and then two days to rest.  The se's from the first 25 tx's were the worst but as the boosts only hit a smaller area things started to get somewhat better after all tx's were complete.  I am so sorry that you have the breathing problem.  Take care Karin in CA
Posts.Title: 9 More to go. Diana63 Diana63

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2008 05:37PM kpopperwell wrote: Hi Diana, I just finished 33 tx's last Wed.  I burned pretty good and I am really tired but I am glad I just took it one day at a time at the end.  Just try to tell youself  that "I can do it, I can do it".  You are so close now that it will be over before you know it.  I drove 30 miles one way everyday in the Los Angeles area for treatment.  The drive alone was tiring.  I also worked 32 hours a week.  I admit that that was a mistake but that is hindsight now.  Please don't give up now.  This board is here to help and get you through. Hang in there Karin in CA
Posts.Title: 9 More to go. Diana63 Diana63
